availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses Mackoy, Sr. (Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Hannah Mackoy. Father of John Mackoy, Henry Mackoy, and Moses Mackoy Jr. Farmer in Grennup County in 1850 and 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850 and five in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 244. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 253. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 112. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 2. Find A Grave, "Moses Fuqua Mackoy, Sr (1800-1869)," Memorial #23962289, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23962289/moses-fuqua-mackoy (accessed June 15, 2017). KYR-0001-029-0583.
